description: This is the protocol for the Q5® Site-Directed Mutagenesis Kit without competent cells

materials.reagent_name: Q5 Site-Directed Mutagenesis Kit (Without Competent Cells) - 10 rxns

components.data:
Assemble the following reagents in a thin-walled PCR tube.
  25 μl RXN FINAL CONC.
Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix 12.5 μl 1X
10 μM Forward Primer 1.25 μl 0.5 μM
10 μM Reverse Primer 1.25 μl 0.5 μM
Template DNA (1–25 ng/μl) 1 μl 1-25 ng
Nuclease-free water 9.0 μl
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Assemble the following reagents in a thin-walled PCR tube.
  25 μl RXN FINAL CONC.
Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix 12.5 μl 1X
10 μM Forward Primer 1.25 μl 0.5 μM
10 μM Reverse Primer 1.25 μl 0.5 μM
Template DNA (1–25 ng/μl) 1 μl 1-25 ng
Nuclease-free water 9.0 μl

components.data: Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix 12.5 μl
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix 12.5 μl
10 μM Forward Primer 1.25μl
10 μM Reverse Primer 1.25μl
Template DNA (1–25 ng/μl) 1μl
Nuclease-free water 9μl
Mix reagents completely.

components.data:
Transfer to a thermocycler and perform the following cycling conditions:
Thermocycling Conditions for a Routine PCR:
STEP TEMP TIME
Initial Denaturation 98°C 30 seconds
25 Cycles 98°C 10 seconds
50–72°C* 10–30 seconds
72°C 20–30 seconds/kb
Final Extension 72°C 2 minutes
Hold 4–10°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Transfer to a thermocycler and perform the following cycling conditions:
Thermocycling Conditions for a Routine PCR:
STEP TEMP TIME
Initial Denaturation 98°C 30 seconds
25 Cycles 98°C 10 seconds
50–72°C* 10–30 seconds
72°C 20–30 seconds/kb
Final Extension 72°C 2 minutes
Hold 4–10°C

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of Q5® Site-Directed Mutagenesis (E0552)
source_data.annotation: * For a Q5-optimized annealing temperature of mutagenic primers, please use NEBaseChanger™, the online NEB primer design software. For pre-designed, back-to-back primer sets, a Ta = Tm + 3 rule can be applied, but optimization may be necessary.
source_data.thread_text: * For a Q5-optimized annealing temperature of mutagenic primers, please use NEBaseChanger™, the online NEB primer design software. For pre-designed, back-to-back primer sets, a Ta = Tm + 3 rule can be applied, but optimization may be necessary.
source_data.body: * For a Q5-optimized annealing temperature of mutagenic primers, please use NEBaseChanger™, the online NEB primer design software. For pre-designed, back-to-back primer sets, a Ta = Tm + 3 rule can be applied, but optimization may be necessary.

components.data:
Assemble the following reagents:

 

  VOLUME FINAL CONC.
PCR Product 1 μl  
2X KLD Reaction Buffer 5 μl 1X
10X KLD Enzyme Mix 1 μl 1X
Nuclease-free Water 3 μl
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Assemble the following reagents:

 

  VOLUME FINAL CONC.
PCR Product 1 μl  
2X KLD Reaction Buffer 5 μl 1X
10X KLD Enzyme Mix 1 μl 1X
Nuclease-free Water 3 μl
PCR Product 1μl
2X KLD Reaction Buffer 5μl
10X KLD Enzyme Mix 1μl
Nuclease-free Water 3μl

components.data: Mix well by pipetting up and down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well by pipetting up and down.

components.data: Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.

components.data: Thaw a 50 μl aliquot of chemically competent E. coli cells on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Thaw a 50 μl aliquot of chemically competent E. coli cells on ice.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of Q5® Site-Directed Mutagenesis (E0552)
source_data.annotation: NEB 5-alpha Competent E. coli (High Efficiency), NEB #C2987, are recommended
source_data.thread_text: NEB 5-alpha Competent E. coli (High Efficiency), NEB #C2987, are recommended
source_data.body: NEB 5-alpha Competent E. coli (High Efficiency), NEB #C2987, are recommended

components.data: Add 5 μl of the KLD mix from the "KLD Section" above to the tube of thawed cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5 μl of the KLD mix from the "KLD Section" above to the tube of thawed cells.

components.data: Carefully flick the tube 4-5 times to mix. Do not vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully flick the tube 4-5 times to mix. Do not vortex.

components.data: Place the mixture on ice for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the mixture on ice for 30 minutes.
Heat shock at 42°C for 30 seconds.
Place on ice for 5 minutes.

components.data: Pipette 950 μl of room temperature SOC into the mixture.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 950 μl of room temperature SOC into the mixture.

components.data: Incubate at 37°C for 60 minutes with shaking (250 rpm).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 37°C for 60 minutes with shaking (250 rpm).

components.data: Mix the cells thoroughly by flicking the tube and inverting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the cells thoroughly by flicking the tube and inverting.
Spread 50-100 μl onto a selection plate.
Incubate overnight at 37°C

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 17 of Q5® Site-Directed Mutagenesis (E0552)
source_data.annotation: It may be necessary (particularly for simple substitution and deletion experiments) to make a 10- to 40-fold dilution of the transformation mix in SOC prior to plating, to avoid a lawn of colonies
source_data.thread_text: It may be necessary (particularly for simple substitution and deletion experiments) to make a 10- to 40-fold dilution of the transformation mix in SOC prior to plating, to avoid a lawn of colonies
source_data.body: It may be necessary (particularly for simple substitution and deletion experiments) to make a 10- to 40-fold dilution of the transformation mix in SOC prior to plating, to avoid a lawn of colonies
